briefdescription.para: Reset value to null.
Reset value to default value (see defaultValue() )
Behavior when clearing value of widget.
Constructor for QgsFilterLineEdit.
Returns the clear mode for the widget.

detaileddescription.para:
The clear mode defines the behavior of the widget when its value is cleared. This defaults to ClearToNull.
setClearMode()
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Returns the default value for the widget.

detaileddescription.para:
The default value is a value which the widget will be reset to if it is cleared and the clearMode() is equal to ClearToDefault.
setDefaultValue()
clearMode()
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Reimplemented to enable/disable the clear action depending on read-only status.
Determine if the current text represents null.

simplesect.para: True if the widget's value is null.

briefdescription.para: Returns the string used for representating null values in the widget.
Will select all text when this widget receives the focus.
Sets the clear mode for the widget.

detaileddescription.para:
The clear mode defines the behavior of the widget when its value is cleared. This defaults to ClearToNull.
clearMode()
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Sets the default value for the widget.

detaileddescription.para:
The default value is a value which the widget will be reset to if it is cleared and the clearMode() is equal to ClearToDefault.
defaultValue
default value
defaultValue()
clearMode()
QGIS 3.0

briefdescription.para: Sets the string representation for null values in the widget.

detaileddescription.para:
This does not affect the values returned for null values by value(), rather it only affects the text that is shown to users when the widget's value is null.
nullValue
string to show when widget's value is null
nullValue()

briefdescription.para: Will select all text when this widget receives the focus.
Sets whether the widget's clear button is visible.

parameterdescription.para: set to false to hide the clear button

briefdescription.para: Define if a search icon shall be shown on the left of the image when no text is entered.

parameterdescription.para: set to false to hide the search icon

briefdescription.para: Show a spinner icon.

detaileddescription.para: This can be used for search boxes to indicate that something is going on in the background.

briefdescription.para: Sets the current text for the widget with support for handling null values.

parameterdescription.para: The text to set. If a null string is provided, the text shown in the widget will be set to the current nullValue().

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the widget's clear button is visible.
Returns if a search icon shall be shown on the left of the image when no text is entered.
Show a spinner icon.

detaileddescription.para: This can be used for search boxes to indicate that something is going on in the background.

briefdescription.para: Returns the text of this edit with support for handling null values.

detaileddescription.para: If the text in the widget matches the current nullValue() then the returned value will be a null string.

simplesect.para: Current text (or null string if it matches the nullValue() property )

briefdescription.para: Clears the widget and resets it to the null value.
Emitted when the widget is cleared.
Will select all text when this widget receives the focus.
Show a spinner icon.

detaileddescription.para: This can be used for search boxes to indicate that something is going on in the background.

briefdescription.para: Same as textChanged() but with support for null values.

parameterdescription.para: The current text or null string if it matches the nullValue() property.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if clear button should be shown.
QLineEdit subclass with built in support for clearing the widget's value and handling custom null value representations.

detaileddescription.para: When using QgsFilterLineEdit the value(), setValue() and clearValue() methods should be used instead of QLineEdit's text(), setText() and clear() methods, and the valueChanged() signal should be used instead of textChanged().
